definitions.text: a special way of doing something
examples: he had a bent for it
he had a special knack for getting into trouble
he couldn't get the hang of it
he adjusted the hang of his coat

definitions.text: a gymnastic exercise performed on the rings or horizontal bar or parallel bars when the gymnast's weight is supported by the arms

examples: The flag hung on the wall

definitions.text: cause to be hanging or suspended
examples: Hang that picture on the wall
The murderer was hanged on Friday
Hang one's head in shame

definitions.text: fall or flow in a certain way
examples: This dress hangs well
Her long black hair flowed down her back
This worry hangs on my mind
The cloud of suspicion hangs over her
The children in the audience attended the recital quietly
She hung on his every word
They attended to everything he said
Heavy fog hung over the valley
hang on to your father's hands
The child clung to his mother's apron
Picasso hangs in this new wing of the museum

definitions.text: prevent from reaching a verdict, of a jury
decorate or furnish with something suspended
examples: Hang wallpaper

definitions.text: be placed in position as by a hinge
examples: This cabinet door doesn't hang right!

definitions.text: place in position as by a hinge so as to allow free movement in one direction
examples: hang a door

definitions.text: suspend (meat) in order to get a gamey taste
examples: hang the venison for a few days
